How many African countries can you identify?
Key differences between SREs and Developers

stories.text:
Highly enjoyed this previous post on empirical evidence available for dev practices (https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=28178257)

This made me start thinking about my own practices, and what processes I could adopt to improve. What suggestions do you have where I can adopt the scientific method to my daily coding, research and software architecting work?
stories.title: Ask HN: How can I use the scientific method to write better code?
Fecal transplants reverse aging in brains of old mice

stories.text: I am checking to see if the organizations would be interested in paying a premium for 100% accurate data extraction from an image or a PDF page? On average, the starting salary of a data entry operator in the US is 28,000 USD/year or 15$/hour or 0.23$/minute. An error correction will take 140 seconds on average to verify an A4-sheet text data or 10-row x 5-column table data that accounts for 0.5$/page. While tons of OCR services claim the best accuracy in character recognition, there is no 100% guarantee. For sensitive data systems, maybe in financial or medical data extraction companies, would you prefer to pay 0.5-1$ USD/page for a guaranteed 100% accuracy?
stories.title: Ask HN: Do you pay a premium for 100% data extraction accuracy?
Simon Wardley on Mapping Our Way to a Common Language
